Package io

Class NewPlayerIO

java.lang.Object
io.NewPlayerIO
Direct Known Subclasses:
NewPlayerConstructorIO, NewPlayerHomeIO, NewPlayerNameIO, NewPlayerShipIO, NewPlayerTimeIO
public abstract class NewPlayerIO
extends java.lang.Object
The NewPlayerIO is an abstract class for creating command line interface. It is the base for NewPlayerConstructorIO NewPlayerNameIO, NewPlayerTimeIO, NewPlayerHomeIO, and NewPlayerShipIO.

The sub-classes created based on NewPlayerIO print prompts for creating a new Trader, take string inputs from users, validate the inputs, and pass the inputs as an ArrayList to TraderCreatorHandler through GameEnvironment.

Author:
Finn van Dorsser, Meng Zhang

    This constructor sets the world attribute with the current World object and initializes a new ArrayList for the commandsList attribute.

    • NewPlayerIO

      public NewPlayerIO​(map.World newWorld)

  • Method Details

    • readCommandArguments

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readCommandArguments()
      This method prints the prompt and available command options returned by getCommandsListString(), gets a an input of string from users, and validates the input. If the input is valid, this method will add the command matching the input to attribute commandArguments. If the input is invalid, this method will print an error message.

      Returns:
      the ArrayList of commandArguments

    • processPlayerInput

      public abstract void processPlayerInput​(java.lang.String choice)
      This is an abstract method which processes a command input from users.
      Parameters:
      choice - a string which matches a command in this interface

    • getCommandsListString

      public java.lang.String getCommandsListString()
      This method iterates attribute commandsList and concatenates all the commands into a string.
      Returns:
      a formated string which includes all the command options

    • setGettingName

      public static void setGettingName​(boolean value)
      This method is the setter for attribute gettingName.
      Parameters:

    • setGettingPlayingTime

      public static void setGettingPlayingTime​(boolean value)
      This method is the setter for attribute gettingPlayingTime.
      Parameters:
      value - true if this interface object is expecting the number of the playing days as the input. Otherwise, it is set false.
